title: MS AccessSgn()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessSgn()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the sign of a number:
SELECT Sgn(243.5) AS SgnNum;

Definition and Usage
The Sgn() function returns the sign of a number.
This function will return one of the following:
If number > 0, it returns 1
If number = 0, it returns 0
If number < 0, it returns -1
Syntax
Sgn(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. The number to return the sign for
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessSgn()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessSgn()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessSgn()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
